text: Wagoner was a community, now extinct, in Allen Township, Miami County, in the U.S. state of Indiana. ==History== Wagoner was named for a small railroad station. In 1887, the community contained a steam saw mill and a general store. A post office was established at Wagoner in 1872, and remained in operation until 1921. J. F. Wagoner served as the original postmaster. ==Geography== Wagoner was located at . ==References== Category:Geography of Miami County, Indiana Category:Former populated places in Indiana Category:Ghost towns in Indiana
title: Wagoner, Indiana
